intro: Tribolium obliterum, commonly known as the ghost weevil, is a species of beetle belonging to the family Curculionidae. It is characterized by its small, elongated body and a distinctive coloration that ranges from pale yellow to reddish-brown. The plant associated with this species is often found in dry, arid environments, particularly in regions with sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. Tribolium obliterum plays a minor role in its ecosystem, primarily as a herbivore that feeds on specific plant species.
